content: this legal case involves parties representing the republic of estonia and the claimant the tartu county court made a decision ruling that the claimant is entitled to receive assets from a joint ownership in relation to a succession including an apartment and a piece of land the claimant is required to pay compensation to the other parties involved the parties have agreed to update the ownership details in the land register the court will determine the procedural costs which may be appealed the judgment will be delivered to the parties the court appointed a guardian defendant to represent the interests of the defendant the court issued an order based on an inheritance certificate and the data collected during the inheritance procedure the claimant wants to divide the ownership of the apartment and pay compensation to the other parties involved the defendants have agreed to the claimants proposal the respondent and the guardian of defendant iii have also agreed to retain defendant iiis share of coownership the court believes that the claimants claim should be satisfied in full the court mentioned a certificate of succession drawn by a notary the claimant and defendants are coowners of a property the claimant submitted an expert assessment of the propertys market price the court explained that if defendant iii wants a different way of dividing the property they must file a counterclaim the court will make a decision based on the evidence already presented the court must consider the interests of the coowners when resolving the claim the defendant iii has a limited legal capacity and a guardian appointed the court will divide the property in a way that does not harm the interests of defendant iii and the guardianship the court confirmed the relevance of a previous decision and gave consent for the transaction the court considered the interests of the ward and the claimant and found it fair to divide the joint property in a way that leaves sole ownership to the claimant the court ruled that the immovable property included in the succession assets must be divided as requested in the lawsuit with the claimant being left with sole ownership and the obligation to compensate the defendants the court also ruled that the procedural costs of the case should be borne by the parties involved
